00268 template <typename T> nothrow_integer::nothrow_integer(const T& n,
00269     typename boost::enable_if<boost::is_integral<T> >::type*,
00270     typename boost::enable_if<boost::is_signed<T> >::type*)
00271 {
00272     try {
00273         _set_signed(n);
00274     } catch (std::exception&) {
00275         _base_attach(0);
00276     }

00306 template <typename T>

00314 
00317 template <typename charT, typename traits>
00318 inline std::basic_ostream<charT,traits>& operator<<(std::basic_ostream<charT,
00319     traits>& out, const nothrow_integer& n)
00320 {
00321     if (n.is_nan()) {
00322         out << detail::nan_text;
00323         return out;
00324     } else {
00325         return detail::operator<<(out, n);
00326     }
00327 }
00328 
00329 template <typename charT, typename traits>
00330 inline std::basic_istream<charT,traits>& operator>>(std::basic_istream<charT,
00331     traits>& in, nothrow_integer& n)
00332 {
00333     if (in.peek()=='#') {
00334         // Must be either #NaN# or an error
00335         char buffer[6];
00336         
00337         // These are efficient and safe, but MSVC complains about them anyway.
00338         //std::streamsize size=in.readsome(buffer, 5);
00339         //buffer[size]=0;
00340         
00341         // Replacing them with these.
00342         char *p = buffer, *pe = p + 5;
00343         while (p != pe) in >> *p++;
00344         *p = 0;
00345         
00346         std::string str(buffer);
00347 
00348         if (str==detail::nan_text) n=nothrow_integer::nan();
00349         else in.setstate(std::ios::failbit);
00350         return in;
00351     } else {
00352         return detail::operator>>(in, n);
00353     }
00354 }

00357 inline void swap(nothrow_integer& left, nothrow_integer& right) {
00358     left._swap(right);
00359 }
